programme.title: Australia
Australia
programme.desc:
Australia: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Shea Adams, Eddie Baroo, Ray Barrett, Tony Barry. Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle over unforgiving landscape, they experience the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by Japanese forces firsthand." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0455824/","name":"Australia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJhMTAyZWMtMjRlZC00NWU3LTg3ODQtYTkyZjRiN2NhY2Y5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413168/","name":"Hugh Jackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011354/","name":"Shea Adams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068628/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064181/","name":"Stuart Beattie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Australia: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1784152089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NzMwOTUwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ4MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NzMwOTUwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ4MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot"},"datePublished":"2008-12-24","description":"Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle ","keywords":"prejudice,year 1942,year 1939,male objectification,australian aborigine","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0455824/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Imdbidia"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Old-style epic romantic movie","reviewBody":"An entertaining romantic drama by Buz Luhrmann, old-Hollywood style.

The movie is set in the Northern Territory of Australia in the years previous to the involvement of Japan in the WW II, and tells the story of Sarah Ashley -an English lady who goes to Australia to try to get her husband back to England and ends becoming the head of their Australian cattle farm-, Drover -an independent free-spirited cattle and horse drover that works for her- and Nullah -a half-caste Aboriginal child who lives in the farm and struggles to live in a world in which he's alien to both blacks and whites.

This is one of those movies that you can say it is done as the movies of the golden era of Hollywood used to be - flashy wonderfully well-looking movie stars, great scenery and great studio settings, detailed recreation of the era's fashion, decoration, atmosphere, etc., , and a simple epic plot with a great love story. Australia has all of this, but also a little bit of corn, a thin plot, weak characters and flaws that are even more noticeable in a super-production like this.

The script is uneven and Manichean (with angels and demons) and mixes several movie genres (romantic comedy, romantic drama, war movie, western movie, and Aboriginal movie) with different degrees of success. The characters are descriptive and without emotional depth, and that affects the acting. However, I loved the depiction of the magic and wisdom of Aboriginal Australians, which is really well presented, with its magic beliefs and philosophical and environmental approach to the world. I think that part is truly genuine and real and reaches the viewer. I also loved that Lady Ashley's character is the one of a true modern woman, as she is a strong-willed free woman, a boss, the boss of her man, a woman who always leads, never submissive or afraid of being alone if she doesn't get what she wants. That's a post-modern woman, so rare to see in cinema nowadays.

The acting is unconvincing on the part of the leading actors. Hugh Jackman's performance is just OK in his role, while Nicole Kidman disappoints in the comic part of the movie, as she seems not to relax when she does so, but she warms up to her usual self when the story becomes more dramatic; she looks beautiful in this movie, like a 50s movie star, although those inflated siliconed lips were a distraction... Jackman and Kidman make a great couple, but their chemistry on camera was nothing memorable and you see yourself seeing two actors playing a couple, not a real couple on screen.

Most supporting actors are good in their roles, especially the Aboriginal ones, who really shine in this film. David Gulpilil is simply terrific, completely believable and inspired in his role of the Aboriginal Elder King George. Brandon Walters, despite his youth, offers a memorable performance, and his face really lights up the screen. Also great is the actor who plays Drove's Aboriginal pal, who also offers a solid performance. They are the ones who really give soul to the movie.

Despite what you might expect, the cinematography is poor. I was expecting the rare beauty of the Northern Territory to be captured by the always stylish and colorful Luhrmann. However, the part of the movie that happens during the dry season is completely opaque and colorless, ugly to watch, while the scenes happening during the rainy season are again limited in colors.To my disenchantment, many of the most colorful and beautiful scenes are digitally created or enhanced, while others seem to have been shot in big studios. Just the Mission island seems to convey that luxurious real feeling of the NT vegetation. Some of the most beautiful bits of the real land, the aerial vistas, look like if they had been taken for a documentary for National Geographic. Where is the emotional connection of the story with the land? In other words, the viewer doesn't go beyond what the eyes see. So, one wonders, why the movie was called Australia and why it was sold as a movie that captured the spirit of this country. To be honest, I thought that most scenes in the movie could have been shot anywhere in the world not in Australia.

The movie is a little too long. Most of the first half an hour could have been removed , condensed or presented in another way to give the non-Aboriginal characters more emotional background and depth. For example, we barely know why Neil Fletcher wants so badly Sarah's farm, and why he's so wicked in general but he loves a lovable sweet good- hearted woman. He is just an archetypal bad-guy, period.

Despite its flaws, I enjoyed the movie, especially the second hour and a half, and that heaven of a man that is Hugh Jackman. God Bless him and his holy body.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":120482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT2H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
programme.desc:
Kiss Kiss Bang Bang: Directed by Shane Black. With Robert Downey Jr., Val Kilmer, Michelle Monaghan, Corbin Bernsen. A murder mystery brings together a private eye, a struggling actress, and a thief masquerading as an actor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0373469/","name":"Kiss Kiss Bang Bang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NDExMDA3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTc2MzA3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000375/","name":"Robert Downey Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000948/","name":"Shane Black"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0356539/","name":"Brett Halliday"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000948/","name":"Shane Black"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kiss Kiss Bang Bang","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi562411033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MzI3MTE0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkyMDQyMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1MzI3MTE0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkyMDQyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Kiss Kiss Bang Bang"},"datePublished":"2005-11-18","description":"A murder mystery brings together a private eye, a struggling actress, and a thief masquerading as an actor.","keywords":"neo noir,actor,thief,kidnapping,nightclub","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0373469/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheMovieMark"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"My kind of dark comedy.","reviewBody":"The term "Kiss Kiss, Bang Bang" was first coined in the 1960s by the Japanese press as a nickname for James Bond. Director Shane Black loved the term and chose it as the movie's title because, "it so clearly represented what this film is." And what exactly is this film? Good question. For starters, it's original. It's a nice change of pace from all of the sequels and remakes we've been inundated with recently. I needed this breath of fresh air after being blind-sided by the news that a remake of Robocop might be on its way.

It's also funny and action-packed. The pace comes at us almost as quickly as the clever dialogue, making it nearly impossible for the average viewer to get bored. You may be offended, you may not appreciate the dark humor, and you may not get the style, but I would predict the majority of you won't get bored. Will I refund your ticket money if you *do* get bored? No, absolutely not. Don't be silly. I'll just say, "Oh well, I guess you're just in the minority on this one!" What I like most about Kiss Kiss, Bang Bang is it's so hard to "genre-lize." See what I did there? Add that term to the Movie Mark Dictionary. When you can't "genre-lize" something then you can't easily force it into any one specific genre. Clever, huh? That's what makes Kiss Kiss, Bang Bang so fun. Is there action? Yes! After all, it's by the same guy who wrote the Lethal Weapon movies. But it's not an action movie.

Is there humor? Indeed. The laughs mostly come from the chemistry between Val Kilmer and Robert Downey Jr. and some of the crazy situations they find themselves in. This is my kind of dark humor. I love to be caught off guard by unexpected moments that make me laugh at things that might not be so funny if they were witnessed in the real world. But this isn't a comedy. The humor is never forced and doesn't have to resort to slapstick or flatulent puppies just to get cheap laughs. Sure, there's a scene that involves peeing on a corpse, but it has to be seen in its context to be appreciated.

If I were forced to affix a label to this then I suppose I'd say it's a darkly comedic murder mystery. It takes itself just seriously enough to keep you in suspense, but it's irreverent enough to simply be fun and entertaining. It works well enough as a farce without ever coming off as a pure parody.

My main complaint is that the story does get a little too confusing. I admit that I openly mocked other reviews that called the story "needlessly complex," but now that I have seen it I totally understand what these reviews are talking about. You'll want to pay careful attention or you'll get lost pretty quickly. I'd even suggest taking notes. If you're not careful you'll become so immersed with keeping up with the rapid-fire dialogue that you could lose focus on the plot details. It's not mind-blowing, but there are just so many characters and minutiae to keep up with that it's easy to lose track of what exactly is going on. If your friends call you "ol' goldfish attention span" then you could be in trouble.

I'm not going to lie to you and tell you that this movie is for everybody. The language gets pretty rough, there is strong sexual content, Val Kilmer is a detective who just happens to be gay and jokes are made at his expense, there's a decent amount of gunplay, and some people just might not appreciate the unconventionality on display.

But I loved the fact that this wasn't formulaic and that the look and style was different than the norm. Black admits to de-saturating the colors in post-production to give the film a crude, rough look. Perhaps some might like their movies a little more bright, but I thought it was quite effective at giving the film the pulp detective story vibe that Black was going for.

I wouldn't recommend this to my mother, so I won't pretend to know whether this fits *your* taste either. It all depends on how you view these kinds of things. Is it gratuitous or knowingly over-the-top? Clever or too clever for its own good? Cheesy or comfortable in its self-awareness? Ask yourself what it takes to offend your senses and let that be your guide.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":218046,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 100 Dinge
100 rzeczy
programme.desc: Directed by Florian David Fitz. With Florian David Fitz, Matthias Schweighöfer, Miriam Stein, Hannelore Elsner. Best friends Toni and Paul decide to relinquish all of their belongings for 100 days, whereby they receive one of their items back on each day. During this challenge the two realize, that the only thing they cannot be without is their friendship. A story about contemporary materialism and the quest for the truely important things in life.

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0116282, Title: Fargo, --- Description: Fargo: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With William H. Macy, Steve Buscemi, Peter Stormare, Kristin Rudrüd. Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116282/","name":"Fargo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJiZDgyZjctYmRjMS00ZjdkLTkwMTEtNGU1NDg3NDQ0Yzk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000513/","name":"William H. Macy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000531/","name":"Frances McDormand","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000114/","name":"Steve Buscemi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106129/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fargo","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2228618777","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Fargo Only Be version","datePublished":"1996-04-05","description":"Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.","keywords":"black comedy,botched crime,snow,fargo north dakota,americana","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116282/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1","dateCreated":"2006-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Best Effort From A Number Of People","reviewBody":"I didn't see this in the theater but saw it the first week it was out for rental, and have enjoyed it ever since. In fact, I probably enjoy this more each time I view it. It's a sick movie, though, make no mistake about that. However, it holds a strange fascination, probably because of the odd characters.

About the story: first, it is NOT a true story as indicated in the movie. That's a lie. It's a fictional kidnapping-turned into murder story with a few bloody scenes, lots of profanity (most of it by Steve Buscemi) and a comedy. Yup, this is pure "black comedy." It's dark humor mixed in with a parody about the way the Scandanavian people in the upper Midwest supposedly speak.

Both William H. Macy and Frances McDormand have some wonderful facial expressions along with their accents. Those two and Buscemi are the lead characters and all three "are a trip." Macy is hilarious; the best character in here, in my opinion. The more I watch this film, the funnier he gets. It's also the best role, I assume, ever for McDormand who was never a star before - or since - this movie. Her character in here, "Marge Gunderson," elevates this movie from just another modern-day sick crime movie, to an original. It's nice to see a wonderful husband-wife relationship, too, as is shown here with her and husband "Norm" (John Lynch).

You have this clean, old-fashioned lady cop (McDormand), a middle-of-the-road bungling car salesman (Macy) and two extreme low-life killers in "Carl Showalter" (Buscemi) and "Gaear Grimsrud" (Peter Stormare) all combining to make this story a mixture not only of people but genres. Other minor characters are strange, too, led by one of Marge's old high school acquaintances "Mike Yanagita" (Steve Park). Add to that some equally-bizarre music (slow violins) and you have this unusual story that brings out the morbid fascination in us viewers.

So, I guess what I am saying is this movie truly is an original, the best film the Coen Brothers have ever made and maybe the rest roles ever for the three main actors, McDormand, Macy and Buscemi.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633292,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0116282, Title: Fargo, --- Description: Fargo: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With William H. Macy, Steve Buscemi, Peter Stormare, Kristin Rudrüd. Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116282/","name":"Fargo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJiZDgyZjctYmRjMS00ZjdkLTkwMTEtNGU1NDg3NDQ0Yzk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000513/","name":"William H. Macy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000531/","name":"Frances McDormand","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000114/","name":"Steve Buscemi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106129/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fargo","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2228618777","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Fargo Only Be version","datePublished":"1996-04-05","description":"Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.","keywords":"black comedy,botched crime,snow,fargo north dakota,americana","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116282/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1","dateCreated":"2006-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Best Effort From A Number Of People","reviewBody":"I didn't see this in the theater but saw it the first week it was out for rental, and have enjoyed it ever since. In fact, I probably enjoy this more each time I view it. It's a sick movie, though, make no mistake about that. However, it holds a strange fascination, probably because of the odd characters.

About the story: first, it is NOT a true story as indicated in the movie. That's a lie. It's a fictional kidnapping-turned into murder story with a few bloody scenes, lots of profanity (most of it by Steve Buscemi) and a comedy. Yup, this is pure "black comedy." It's dark humor mixed in with a parody about the way the Scandanavian people in the upper Midwest supposedly speak.

Both William H. Macy and Frances McDormand have some wonderful facial expressions along with their accents. Those two and Buscemi are the lead characters and all three "are a trip." Macy is hilarious; the best character in here, in my opinion. The more I watch this film, the funnier he gets. It's also the best role, I assume, ever for McDormand who was never a star before - or since - this movie. Her character in here, "Marge Gunderson," elevates this movie from just another modern-day sick crime movie, to an original. It's nice to see a wonderful husband-wife relationship, too, as is shown here with her and husband "Norm" (John Lynch).

You have this clean, old-fashioned lady cop (McDormand), a middle-of-the-road bungling car salesman (Macy) and two extreme low-life killers in "Carl Showalter" (Buscemi) and "Gaear Grimsrud" (Peter Stormare) all combining to make this story a mixture not only of people but genres. Other minor characters are strange, too, led by one of Marge's old high school acquaintances "Mike Yanagita" (Steve Park). Add to that some equally-bizarre music (slow violins) and you have this unusual story that brings out the morbid fascination in us viewers.

So, I guess what I am saying is this movie truly is an original, the best film the Coen Brothers have ever made and maybe the rest roles ever for the three main actors, McDormand, Macy and Buscemi.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633292,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

True to life story. Original. Bleak, yet impressive.","reviewBody":"These kind of stories about loosers dont get made a lot. NOT a crowd pleaser. Dont think for a second you will get to see Charlize Theron in any kind of hot or glamorous scenes. She plays a character that is dead inside. Mentally scarred for life. But she is unaware of it. She is about to find out though when she revisits her old highschool friends.

Some movies are simply a kick in my gut. This is one of those. I would not recommend it to any of my friends who want to be entertained. BUT if one wants to see a really true to life story about PAIN and ISOLATION then this is the movie for you...

"Enjoy..."","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81638,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0116282, Title: Fargo, --- Description: Fargo: Directed by Joel Coen, Ethan Coen. With William H. Macy, Steve Buscemi, Peter Stormare, Kristin Rudrüd. Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116282/","name":"Fargo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJiZDgyZjctYmRjMS00ZjdkLTkwMTEtNGU1NDg3NDQ0Yzk1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000513/","name":"William H. Macy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000531/","name":"Frances McDormand","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000114/","name":"Steve Buscemi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106129/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001053/","name":"Ethan Coen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001054/","name":"Joel Coen"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fargo","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2228618777","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmExN2VjZTMtMzhlNi00NDRiLWE0YzAtNDFiNjc2ZTUyZTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Fargo Only Be version","datePublished":"1996-04-05","description":"Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.","keywords":"black comedy,botched crime,snow,fargo north dakota,americana","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116282/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1","dateCreated":"2006-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Best Effort From A Number Of People","reviewBody":"I didn't see this in the theater but saw it the first week it was out for rental, and have enjoyed it ever since. In fact, I probably enjoy this more each time I view it. It's a sick movie, though, make no mistake about that. However, it holds a strange fascination, probably because of the odd characters.

About the story: first, it is NOT a true story as indicated in the movie. That's a lie. It's a fictional kidnapping-turned into murder story with a few bloody scenes, lots of profanity (most of it by Steve Buscemi) and a comedy. Yup, this is pure "black comedy." It's dark humor mixed in with a parody about the way the Scandanavian people in the upper Midwest supposedly speak.

Both William H. Macy and Frances McDormand have some wonderful facial expressions along with their accents. Those two and Buscemi are the lead characters and all three "are a trip." Macy is hilarious; the best character in here, in my opinion. The more I watch this film, the funnier he gets. It's also the best role, I assume, ever for McDormand who was never a star before - or since - this movie. Her character in here, "Marge Gunderson," elevates this movie from just another modern-day sick crime movie, to an original. It's nice to see a wonderful husband-wife relationship, too, as is shown here with her and husband "Norm" (John Lynch).

You have this clean, old-fashioned lady cop (McDormand), a middle-of-the-road bungling car salesman (Macy) and two extreme low-life killers in "Carl Showalter" (Buscemi) and "Gaear Grimsrud" (Peter Stormare) all combining to make this story a mixture not only of people but genres. Other minor characters are strange, too, led by one of Marge's old high school acquaintances "Mike Yanagita" (Steve Park). Add to that some equally-bizarre music (slow violins) and you have this unusual story that brings out the morbid fascination in us viewers.

So, I guess what I am saying is this movie truly is an original, the best film the Coen Brothers have ever made and maybe the rest roles ever for the three main actors, McDormand, Macy and Buscemi.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":633292,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

The kids go head to head with an unstoppable enemy who has targeted Leslie -- or more accurately, the child she's carrying. Nico draws them all into a dark realm where its ruler Morgan le Fay is much more nefarious than anyone the kids have yet to face."},"datePublished":"2017-11-21","description":"After discovering their parents are super-villains in disguise, a group of teenagers band together to run away from their homes in order to atone for their parents' actions and to discover the secrets of their origins.","keywords":"shared universe,superheroine,teenager,super villain,marvel cinematic universe","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1236246/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eisenmyer1234"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"OK show. Thought it would be better","reviewBody":"The show is moving at a much slower pace than the trailer suggested which I wouldn't have minded had the show been any good. Runaways is decent at best with mundane script writing and an over saturation of clichéd characters. They've introduced so many characters early on that you're almost perplexed at times as to who's who and their relation to the other characters as well as their relevance to whatever the plot is becoming. As for the plot, it tries to be too mysterious and foreboding that it only confuses itself in numerous plot holes and bad character decisions for the sake of extending the story and providing unnecessary drama.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23011,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7}}</script><metacontent="

Losing his girlfriend because he was at an auction dramatically getting the magical philosopher's stone instead of a date, he needs a vacation - New Orleans but finds himself busy saving Earth from the curse of the Judas chalice/vampires." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1146438/","name":"The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MDM2MzEyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxNjMzMg@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001864/","name":"Noah Wyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001117/","name":"Bruce Davison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065664/","name":"Stana Katic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003899/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0773605/","name":"Marco Schnabel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0864435/","name":"David N. Titcher"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3761111833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1NTk3NjgwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg0NDQzMg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1NTk3NjgwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg0NDQzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The trailer for the DVD release of The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice"},"datePublished":"2008-12-07","description":"Losing his girlfriend because he was at an auction dramatically getting the magical philosopher's stone instead of a date, he needs a vacation - New Orleans but finds himself busy saving Earth from the curse of the Judas chalice/vamp","keywords":"vampire,dracula,judas chalice,supernatural artefact,vampire suicide","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1146438/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"subego"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"just good fun!","reviewBody":"How I love these movies! Sure, there is nothing groundbreaking or revolutionary about them, but the combination of humor (Jane Curtain, Bob Newhart,) Good direction (jonathan Frakes,) and a good solid lead (Noah Wyle,) just makes for enjoyable television. One of the most wonderful things about the series is that it doesn't presume the lowest common denominator on the part of the audience's intellect. It seems to be a series full of historic references that are designed to be aimed at people who can appreciate them. \n\nI very much enjoy the whole setup to the characters themselves. They are each given delightful backstorys that are fun as well as convincing. I have seen this compared to the Indiana Jones movies. While I agree with that in concept, I think there is a certain playfulness in these movies that the more serious...and far more expensive...Indian Jones films lack. My only regret is that these movies only come out every couple of years. I think that it would be great if this were turned into a regular series...or at least a few of them each year. These movies, to me, make up for the wasteland that is most of "normal" television programming."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12522,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Librarian-turned-adventurer Flynn Carsen endeavors to find King Solomon's mines." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0455596/","name":"The Librarian: Return to King Solomon's Mines","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNzc4NzYyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDYwMTc0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001864/","name":"Noah Wyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000270/","name":"Gabrielle Anwar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627878/","name":"Bob Newhart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009512/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003899/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0236787/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0773605/","name":"Marco Schnabel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0864435/","name":"David N. Titcher"}],"datePublished":"2006-12-03","description":"Librarian-turned-adventurer Flynn Carsen endeavors to find King Solomon's mines.","keywords":"reference to peter pan,mine,king solomon,skull,scroll","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0455596/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"deejou"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Silly, but a lot of fun","reviewBody":"If you don't take it too seriously you'll really enjoy this. Noah Wyle returns as the Librarian Flynn. This time he sets out to find King Solomon's Mine together with the help of fellow "nerd" Emily Davenport (Gabrielle Anwar). I found a lot of similarities to Indiana Jones as well as The Mummy is this film. But it did not ruin the Librarian 2 for me at all. It's still different enough to stand alone. I think the character Flynn makes this movie. He is an interesting and well written character who really entertains. I also enjoyed the addition of Gabrielle Anwar, whose love/hate relationship with Flynn creates some nice laughs. Overall The Librarian 2 has enough action, adventure and twists to keep you interested. Basically if you liked the first one, you'll like this one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13654,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

The kids go head to head with an unstoppable enemy who has targeted Leslie -- or more accurately, the child she's carrying. Nico draws them all into a dark realm where its ruler Morgan le Fay is much more nefarious than anyone the kids have yet to face."},"datePublished":"2017-11-21","description":"After discovering their parents are super-villains in disguise, a group of teenagers band together to run away from their homes in order to atone for their parents' actions and to discover the secrets of their origins.","keywords":"shared universe,superheroine,teenager,super villain,marvel cinematic universe","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1236246/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eisenmyer1234"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"OK show. Thought it would be better","reviewBody":"The show is moving at a much slower pace than the trailer suggested which I wouldn't have minded had the show been any good. Runaways is decent at best with mundane script writing and an over saturation of clichéd characters. They've introduced so many characters early on that you're almost perplexed at times as to who's who and their relation to the other characters as well as their relevance to whatever the plot is becoming. As for the plot, it tries to be too mysterious and foreboding that it only confuses itself in numerous plot holes and bad character decisions for the sake of extending the story and providing unnecessary drama.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23011,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7}}</script><metacontent="

Nico draws them all into a dark realm where its ruler Morgan le Fay is much more nefarious than anyone the kids have yet to face.","datePublished":"2017-11-21","description":"After discovering their parents are super-villains in disguise, a group of teenagers band together to run away from their homes in order to atone for their parents' actions and to discover the secrets of their origins.","keywords":"shared universe,superheroine,teenager,super villain,marvel cinematic universe","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1236246/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"eisenmyer1234","dateCreated":"2017-11-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"OK show. Thought it would be better","reviewBody":"The show is moving at a much slower pace than the trailer suggested which I wouldn't have minded had the show been any good. Runaways is decent at best with mundane script writing and an over saturation of clichéd characters. They've introduced so many characters early on that you're almost perplexed at times as to who's who and their relation to the other characters as well as their relevance to whatever the plot is becoming. As for the plot, it tries to be too mysterious and foreboding that it only confuses itself in numerous plot holes and bad character decisions for the sake of extending the story and providing unnecessary drama.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23011,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7</script><metacontent="

series,evolution","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0965394/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"umar_n12","dateCreated":"2008-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Getting pretty good!","reviewBody":"This is a review of the first season on TV, which should really be known as season 1 on IMDb, and the webisodes season 0.

Essentially there are three main characters, all of which believable, even Tapping's accent, and I'm saying that as a Brit. She's great as Magnus, not overdone, but sensitive, slightly badass and played right. She has a daughter, Ashley. She's instantly likable and Emelie Ullerup doesn't fall into the trap of making her the typical blond 'Yeah, uhuh I like totally, like, kick- ass. Isn't that cool!' character. Instead she's much better and thankfully without a teenage crisis. I'll get onto Robin Dunne's excellent Will in a sec.

Sanctuary is more than just the sum of its parts. It has a great grittiness to it, a real world, almost familiar environment. It's slightly dark, but optimistic at the same part. 30 minutes into the pilot and I really liked it. Will was believable, I even liked and sympathised with him. the way it was done felt like a feature, not really like an hour long weekly show. The whole actual Sanctuary concept wasn't done too fantastically. However I felt it wasn't perfect but it's taken me 2 more episodes to think that actually it's worth continuing to watch.

For Brits, its on ITV 4, mondays at 9. Or 8. Pretty sure it's 9, but check. if you don't have ITV 4, it's on their catch up thing on the site. For Americans it's on Hulu and Sci Fi's Rewind.

Have fun getting into it, looking forward to see where it goes.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19555,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3</script><metacontent="

A secret military team, SG-1, is formed to explore other planets through the recently discovered Stargates." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0118480/","name":"Stargate SG-1","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3MjEwMTc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQ2NjQ4NA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000760/","name":"Richard Dean Anderson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0788218/","name":"Michael Shanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0850102/","name":"Amanda Tapping"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129774/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005244/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0214390/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322106/","name":"Jonathan Glassner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0942249/","name":"Brad Wright"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stargate SG-1: The Complete Tenth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi444989721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzczMjM1M2MtNzFjZi00ZWYwLTlkNzAtOGQwN2E2MzdhMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzczMjM1M2MtNzFjZi00ZWYwLTlkNzAtOGQwN2E2MzdhMDg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","datePublished":"1997-07-27","description":"A secret military team, SG-1, is formed to explore other planets through the recently discovered Stargates.","keywords":"shared universe,military,message from outer space,alternate history,2000s","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118480/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"johndec","dateCreated":"2004-11-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well Done!","reviewBody":"The movie was groundbreaking, and its ideas had great potential for further development. Usually, sequels are made to continue the story on the big screen. Creating this excellent series was a much better decision than producing lousy sequels for the masses. 

Fans of the movie get to further explore all the ideas: The Stargate system, used by humans to travel the galaxy for thousands of years; Egyptian, Norse, and alien mythology; true science fiction - with fictional devices and concepts based on current science; and human exploration of our known universe  part of what made Star Trek so popular. 

You see the characters develop over time, the quirky unexpected humor, the use of an alien who doesn't fully understand American English (like Data), the struggle of the oppressed, the lengths humans go in order to survive, politics and government bureaucracy, and the underlying tenet that there is more to human life then our brief appearance on planet Earth.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85393,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4</script><metacontent="

for Sanctuary: Season Four","datePublished":"2008-10-03","description":"Stem cells, gene therapy, transplants, and cloning have changed the definition of "humanity" in the modern world, but the darker side contains monsters that only few are brave enough to face, because the future lies in their hands.","keywords":"2000s,2010s,paranormal phenomena,psychotronic series,evolution","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0965394/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"umar_n12","dateCreated":"2008-10-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Getting pretty good!","reviewBody":"This is a review of the first season on TV, which should really be known as season 1 on IMDb, and the webisodes season 0.

Essentially there are three main characters, all of which believable, even Tapping's accent, and I'm saying that as a Brit. She's great as Magnus, not overdone, but sensitive, slightly badass and played right. She has a daughter, Ashley. She's instantly likable and Emelie Ullerup doesn't fall into the trap of making her the typical blond 'Yeah, uhuh I like totally, like, kick- ass. Isn't that cool!' character. Instead she's much better and thankfully without a teenage crisis. I'll get onto Robin Dunne's excellent Will in a sec.

Sanctuary is more than just the sum of its parts. It has a great grittiness to it, a real world, almost familiar environment. It's slightly dark, but optimistic at the same part. 30 minutes into the pilot and I really liked it. Will was believable, I even liked and sympathised with him. the way it was done felt like a feature, not really like an hour long weekly show. The whole actual Sanctuary concept wasn't done too fantastically. However I felt it wasn't perfect but it's taken me 2 more episodes to think that actually it's worth continuing to watch.

For Brits, its on ITV 4, mondays at 9. Or 8. Pretty sure it's 9, but check. if you don't have ITV 4, it's on their catch up thing on the site. For Americans it's on Hulu and Sci Fi's Rewind.

Have fun getting into it, looking forward to see where it goes.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19555,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3</script><metacontent="

She's instantly likable and Emelie Ullerup doesn't fall into the trap of making her the typical blond 'Yeah, uhuh I like totally, like, kick- ass. Isn't that cool!' character. programme.title: Ma famille et le loup
Chłopiec i wilk
programme.desc:
Ma famille et le loup: Directed by Adrià García. With Carmen Maura, Pierre Rochefort, Bruno Salomone, Franc Bruneau. 9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5869404/","name":"Ma famille et le loup","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYwNmVlNTctM2MxYS00MWUyLTg0ZTYtYTg2NDIzMWU0YmNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA1MDczNjc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0560962/","name":"Carmen Maura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734004/","name":"Pierre Rochefort"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758912/","name":"Bruno Salomone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2348224/","name":"Adrià García"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0596308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0698042/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0384091/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5526293/","name":"Valérie Magis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166131/","name":"Stéphane Malandrin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159646/","name":"Víctor Maldonado"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2453519385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2ZiZWJhZTAtNThjMS00NWRhLWEzNDMtNDFkYTJlNDdjZWZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2019-08-21","description":"9 years old Hugo spends the summer holidays with his cousins and his grandma Sara. When they learn that the wolf is coming to pick her up, the children are mobilizing to save their grandmother and embark on an unforgettable adventure","keywords":"children","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5869404/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"The wolf always wins.","reviewBody":"In the children's imaginative world there are the goodies (Santa Claus, the Tooth Fairy) and the baddies ( the Wolf ,the Bogey Man) .The Wolf wins in Charles Perrault' s "the Little Red riding Hood" ,even though the tale was often sweetened when told to children (the hunter's intervention).

Grandma met the Wolf when she was young (a little red riding hood ), but she was saved by the man who would become her husband (the equivalent of the hunter).But this summer ,he comes to take her back,now that she is about to celebrate her eightieth birthday.

Her grandchilden are not prepared to accept it ; instead of bickering ,they will spend their holidays looking for a way to prevent grandma from being "wolfed" .But the old lady had already told Hugo -it was the first time he had met her ,for his dad is a workaholic,often on his mobile - there was no sense in trying for she made a deal when she was young,and now her time has come.In the show they stage , granny appears in the finale -after some ponderous acts- just to say goodbye to all her family to urge them to carry on:we survive through our children and our life is eternal.

The movie adds computer animation for the imaginary scenes; the last ones ,in which the wolf intervenes with real characters,a la "Mary Poppins" , are the most successful.

By and large, nevertheless, acting and directing are not equal to the subject :with the exception of the deeply moving Carmen Maura , the actors overplay : the male cast ,particularly , tries to hog the stage and they are almost unbearable ;besides ,in the bakery , they got an incredible nerve ,not exactly an useful example for the young audience ;poetry which was present in Jean-Claude Brialy 's "Eglantine" (1971) on a similar subject is nowhere to be found.

That said, even though the results are not always satisfying , it was a good way to deal with a harsh subject :the ineluctable .The younger audience will certainly need explanations from their parents after viewing it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H20M"}</script><metacontent="

wish everyone gets to see this special movie","reviewBody":"It is a shame that a meaningful film like this one is not promoted to get more people to watch it, because it contains many hard truths that need to be told, but at least the filmmakers don't ram the message down the viewer's throat the way some movies do. Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4096179737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVkN2UxZTgtMmZiYi00OWM0LThjMjYtOTEyMDViOTg4YjYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVkN2UxZTgtMmZiYi00OWM0LThjMjYtOTEyMDViOTg4YjYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"2020-06-26","description":"A Democratic strategist helps a retired veteran run for mayor in a small, conservative Midwest town.","keywords":"political satire,american politics,election campaign,rural america,marine veteran","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9076562/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sir_AmirSyarif"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A rather toothless critique of the modern American political process","reviewBody":"Jon Stewart's 'Irresistible' is a critique of the modern American political process but it is rather toothless. The plot is rich but it only skims the surface of the problems but does not address any of it. It has some clever moments, wits, and twists. But, as a whole, it is forgettable, you wont remember or care to remember a thing after finishing the movie. The humor, in general, is too broad and feels flat. Steve Carell delivers a steadily funny and wholesome performance, while the underutilized Rose Byrne portrays the evil and seductive strategist perfectly.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

Stan's bullied high school buddy can use a monster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8236366/","name":"The Shed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmJjNzY5MjItMmVjNy00OWJjLTliNDYtYWIxYTU1ODA2OWY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4487395/","name":"Jay Jay Warren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4927593/","name":"Cody Kostro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8961618/","name":"Sofia Happonen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2876628/","name":"Frank Sabatella"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0247116/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228008/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11174712/","name":"Jason Rice"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2876628/","name":"Frank Sabatella"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3757686553","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2FhZjRiY2EtNjYxYy00NzFjLWFiODAtMWNkODA3ODNjMzcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2FhZjRiY2EtNjYxYy00NzFjLWFiODAtMWNkODA3ODNjMzcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stan lives with his abusive grandfather and tries to protect his best friend from high school bullies. When he discovers a murderous creature has taken refuge inside his tool shed, he tries to battle the demon alone until his bullied friend discovers the creature and has a far more sinister plan."},"datePublished":"2019-11-15","description":"A hunter gets bitten by a vampire and runs into a shed to avoid sunlight. Stan, a 17 y.o. on probation, and his supervisor grandpa live next to it. Stan's bullied high school buddy can use a monster.","keywords":"school,natural horror,creature feature","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8236366/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"robbierobin"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ummm OK kinda","reviewBody":"It had plenty of scenes that simply didn't make sense and pretty obvious what type of things were about to happen all throughout the movie. However there was a bit of a plot twist in the end.

The two things that seemed unbearably nonsensical to me, is, (one) if you have a vampire living in your wooden shed on a farm, far away from people, why in heavens would you not set it ablaze during one of the many sunny days available?

Secondly, even though the vampire wronged the main character, the vampire seems to have a personal vendetta out for him for absolutely no reason whatsoever.

There's no backstory, so you really don't know what's the deal with the vampire population. Is it just the one at the beginning, what are the rules, etc","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1863,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mr. Jones
Obywatel Jones
programme.desc:
Mr. Jones: Directed by Agnieszka Holland. With James Norton, Vanessa Kirby, Peter Sarsgaard, Joseph Mawle. A Welsh journalist breaks the news in the western media of the famine in Ukraine in the early 1930s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6828390/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIzMGZlNGQtNWFlMC00NDc1LTliNmQtNDA3ODRlYzhjMGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Biography","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3584268/","name":"James Norton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3948952/","name":"Vanessa Kirby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765597/","name":"Peter Sarsgaard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002140/","name":"Agnieszka Holland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0491378/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0352409/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10388460/","name":"Andrea Chalupa"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi392806169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjliNjIxNmUtZmQ0Ny00YjRkLWFmYTgtM2NlMDQ3MmZmOTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjliNjIxNmUtZmQ0Ny00YjRkLWFmYTgtM2NlMDQ3MmZmOTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Gareth Jones, an ambitious Welsh journalist, travelled to the Soviet Union in 1933 and uncovered the appalling truth behind the Soviet "utopia". His quest quickly turned into a life-or-death journey... helping inspire Orwell's Animal Farm."},"datePublished":"2019-10-25","description":"A Welsh journalist breaks the news in the western media of the famine in Ukraine in the early 1930s.","keywords":"ukraine,soviet union,holodomor,famine,genocide","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6828390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SteveMierzejewski"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in the USSR","reviewBody":"This is a powerful film which I'm afraid few people will watch. Even those who watch it, may feel the situations it portrays are exaggerated or completely made up. They are not. The problems caused by Stalin in Ukraine are, if anything, downplayed.

But beyond the historical accuracy are the questions about the behavior of the people and their morality as it is portrayed in the film. Did diplomats and politicians really behave like this? Not only did they behave like this. They continue to behave like this. I've worked in government NGOs overseas and I've seen the insincerity of most diplomats close up. I've also experienced their ability to blind themselves of the truth if the truth endangers their high paid positions.

There are people out there now who know the truth and who are being told to keep quiet. There are people I've known who were undermined when trying to do what was right. So, this movie is telling the truth for them. You may not like what it has to say, but who says the truth has to be pleasant.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7885,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT2H21M"}</script><metacontent="

A Welsh journalist breaks the news in the western media of the famine in Ukraine in the early 1930s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6828390/","name":"Mr. Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIzMGZlNGQtNWFlMC00NDc1LTliNmQtNDA3ODRlYzhjMGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Biography","Drama","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3584268/","name":"James Norton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3948952/","name":"Vanessa Kirby","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0765597/","name":"Peter Sarsgaard"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002140/","name":"Agnieszka Holland"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0491378/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118772/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0352409/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10388460/","name":"Andrea Chalupa"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi392806169","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjliNjIxNmUtZmQ0Ny00YjRkLWFmYTgtM2NlMDQ3MmZmOTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjliNjIxNmUtZmQ0Ny00YjRkLWFmYTgtM2NlMDQ3MmZmOTAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Gareth Jones, an ambitious Welsh journalist, travelled to the Soviet Union in 1933 and uncovered the appalling truth behind the Soviet "utopia". His quest quickly turned into a life-or-death journey... helping inspire Orwell's Animal Farm.","datePublished":"2019-10-25","description":"A Welsh journalist breaks the news in the western media of the famine in Ukraine in the early 1930s.","keywords":"ukraine,soviet union,holodomor,famine,genocide","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6828390/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SteveMierzejewski","dateCreated":"2020-02-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Back in the USSR","reviewBody":"This is a powerful film which I'm afraid few people will watch. Even those who watch it, may feel the situations it portrays are exaggerated or completely made up. They are not. The problems caused by Stalin in Ukraine are, if anything, downplayed.

But beyond the historical accuracy are the questions about the behavior of the people and their morality as it is portrayed in the film. Did diplomats and politicians really behave like this? Not only did they behave like this. They continue to behave like this. I've worked in government NGOs overseas and I've seen the insincerity of most diplomats close up. I've also experienced their ability to blind themselves of the truth if the truth endangers their high paid positions.

There are people out there now who know the truth and who are being told to keep quiet. There are people I've known who were undermined when trying to do what was right. So, this movie is telling the truth for them. You may not like what it has to say, but who says the truth has to be pleasant.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7885,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"duration":"PT2H21M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths
7 psychopatów
programme.desc:
Seven Psychopaths: Directed by Martin McDonagh. With Michael Pitt, Michael Stuhlbarg, Sam Rockwell, Colin Farrell. A struggling screenwriter inadvertently becomes entangled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld after his oddball friends kidnap a gangster's beloved Shih Tzu." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1931533/","name":"Seven Psychopaths","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgwMzUxMjc0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzQ2MjYyOA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268199/","name":"Colin Farrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005377/","name":"Sam Rockwell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732981/","name":"Martin McDonagh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197272/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1732981/","name":"Martin McDonagh"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version -- #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1273668633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4MDEyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzg1NTM0OA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4MDEyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzg1NTM0OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A struggling screenwriter inadvertently becomes entangled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld after his oddball friends kidnap a gangster's beloved Shih Tzu. "},"datePublished":"2012-10-12","description":"A struggling screenwriter inadvertently becomes entangled in the Los Angeles criminal underworld after his oddball friends kidnap a gangster's beloved Shih Tzu.","keywords":"gangster,shih tzu,screenwriter,black woman murders a white man,shot in the belly","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1931533/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another title of piercing accuracy","reviewBody":"Let's get the insane plot of Seven Psychopaths out of the way: Marty (Collin Farrell) is a struggling Irish screenwriter, who hopes to finish his screenplay for a film called "Seven Psychopaths," while battling a case of writer's block and author-indecisiveness. His best friend is Billy (Sam Rockwell), a boisterous dog-thief, who usually winds up dictating Marty's life rather than helping him along in tough times. Hans (Christopher Walken) is Billy's best friend and partner in crime when it comes to dog-snatching. After both Hans and Billy steal an unpredictable crime boss's (Woody Harrelson) shih-ztu, it becomes a violent, relentless cat-and-mouse chase to get the pup back, and in the meantime, we get lengthy monologues between characters about the production of "Seven Psychopaths" and how Marty's inspiration begins to bubble when he starts considering the barrage of real psychopaths in his own life.

There are several films that exist about the movie-making process and it is a very difficult genre to make effectively. Seven Psychopaths succeeds in balancing the art of characters and the art of plot coherency, and it doesn't cross the line of becoming too involved in the process and too concerned with "in" jokes that leave the audience lost. To put it simply; the actors look like they're having fun, but they make sure we are still amused and connected with the film.

Right off the bat, the first thing one can commend about this entire experience are the rich performances by actors of all different career heights. Collin Farrell plays a wonderful straight-laced man victim to idiocy and unhelpful circumstances, and is only made better by Sam Rockwell's character's shameless belligerence. Woody Harrelson, giving us one of his many diverse roles in recent years, has the rare ability of rustling up a fierce moment of seriousness and delivering a devilishly funny laugh in the same breath. And who could forget supporting-role king Christopher Walken, who continuously borders the line of self-parody here in a memorably sophisticated role? At times, Seven Psychopaths is a witty riot and at other times, it can be monotonous and lengthy. For starters, the film looks and feels like a Quentin Tarantino film blended with the likes of Guy Ritchie. Shots have a very slim sense of narrative cohesion and many, many times are we left bewildered at what we just watched. It's also apparent that the film has a meta, self-aware tone that can be pleasantly charming, and sometimes cloying and overly-cheeky. To simply my feelings; after many sequences was I trying to comprehend what was just given to me and how was I supposed to digest the experience all together.

I mentioned my feelings that the film seemed to drag and felt a little too long - specifically the final scene in the desert which is roughly twenty-five to thirty minutes. Perhaps if your interest is in cheeky comedies and self-aware humor, you won't mind at all. The film is certainly smarter and a lot brighter than some of the flyweight, narrow-minded comic exercises that have bestowed on the mainstream public in recent years. For once, it's refreshing to see a comedy pay close attention to its characters, its events, and its performance, never shortchanging anyone in the process.

NOTE: There's also something very, very different about the cinematography of this picture, different from any kind of visual atmosphere I have seen this year. The southern California area seems to be captured through a grungy, saturated lens with colors appearing bright, humid, and very warm. This easily makes Seven Psychopaths one of the most visually calm pictures of the year.

Starring: Colin Farrell, Sam Rockwell, Woody Harrelson, Christopher Walken, Tom Waits, Abbie Cornish, and Olga Kurylenko. Directed by: Martin McDonagh.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":245919,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

credits.actor: Hanna Konarowska
Piotr Stramowski
Karina Kunkiewicz

programme.title: Myszy i szczury
programme.desc: Dramatyczne losy małego Adasia (Miłosz Kwiecień), którego przykre doświadczenia sprzed lat odbijają się na psychice całej rodziny. Wzruszająca historia o bezgranicznej miłości, przeznaczeniu, poczuciu winy i ponoszeniu konsekwencji za swoje czyny.

credits.actor: Michał Krzywicki
Kacper Anuszewski
Rafał Gerlach
Joanna Kulig, Adam Woronowicz, Alan Tybulczuk

programme.title: 60 kilo niczego
programme.desc: Zimny poranek w odkrywkowej kopalni kruszców. Krzysztof (Grzegorz Damięcki) zaczyna pierwszy dzień pracy na stanowisku kierownika. Wyraźnie nie pasuje on do środowiska pracowników fizycznych. W trosce o własną pozycję, zamierza trzymać dyscyplinę twardą ręką. Nagły wypadek, którego ofiarą staje się jeden z ukraińskich robotników, wystawia zasady moralne Krzysztofa na próbę. Zdaje on sobie sprawę z tego, że łatwo być stanowczym tylko w sprzyjających okolicznościach. Jednak trudno mu przeciwstawić się złu, kiedy w grę wchodzą dramatyczne konsekwencje.

credits.actor: Grzegorz Damięcki
Artem Manuilov
Andrzej Grabowski

programme.title: Leszy
programme.desc: Krzysiek, po dziesięciu latach nieobecności, zabiera swojego syna na polowanie. Mężczyzna poprzez wyprawę myśliwską chce odzyskać zaufanie syna i nadrobić stracony czas. Adrenalina, alkohol i miło spędzony czas sprawiają, że mężczyźni się do siebie zbliżają. Jednak niedojrzałość Krzysztofa prowadzi doprowadza do wielkiej tragedii.

credits.actor: Tadeusz Ratuszniak
Łukasz Gawroński
Dominika Sakowicz

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

credits.actor: Magdalena Czerwińska
Marek Kossakowski
Marian Dziędziel
Grzegorz Damięcki, Andrzej Seweryn, Sylwia Juszczak

programme.title: Techno
programme.desc: 60-letni Ryszard (Leszek Abrahamowicz) jest rolnikiem, który żyje w izolacji od świata. Jego głównym zajęciem jest opieka nad chorą na alzheimera żoną, Joanną (Danuta Stenka). Stan kobiety coraz szybciej się pogarsza. Pewnego dnia mężczyzna poznaje młodą dziewczynę z wielkiego miasta, Sonię (Michalina Olszańska), która wprowadza go w świat muzyki techno. Dzięki temu, chociaż na krótką chwilę, Ryszard może zapomnieć o życiowych trudnościach.

credits.actor: Leszek Abrahamowicz
Danuta Stenka
Michalina Olszańska

programme.desc: On Chesil Beach: Directed by Dominic Cooke. With Billy Howle, Saoirse Ronan, Andy Burse, Rasmus Hardiker. Based on Ian McEwan's novel. In 1962 England, a young couple find their idyllic romance colliding with issues of sexual freedom and societal pressure, leading to an awkward and fateful wedding night.","keywords":"honeymoon,fear of intimacy,year 1962,wedding night,chamber music","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1667321/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chrisjorg"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stylish","reviewBody":"Saw this at the London Film Festival. Saoirse Ronan and Billy Howle enter the perilous territory of marriage in a slow, sleek coming-of-age story adapted from Ian McEwan's 2007 novel. I found the cinematography to be superb, the play of colours very well done in accordance to the mood. I wish there had been more development near the end, but the film was sufficiently beguiling to give it a 7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10266,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

Like a Dame","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1185397529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMzNjkyOGQtMjRhZS00NDQzLThiYjEtMGM3ODE2OTBlMzZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMzNjkyOGQtMjRhZS00NDQzLThiYjEtMGM3ODE2OTBlMzZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"datePublished":"2018-05-02","description":"Dames Judi Dench, Eileen Atkins, Joan Plowright, and Maggie Smith get together for tea to reminisce and discuss their acting careers.","keywords":"actress,octogenarian,reminiscence,four word title,elderly protagonist","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7363336/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"larrys3"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Film Has Its Flaws But These Four Grand Dames Make it All a Pleasure","reviewBody":"Four grand Dames of England, Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, Joan Plowright, and Eileen Atkins get together and reminisce at Plowright's country home. I would say the wonderful archival film snippets of some of their performances on stage and screen would be enough for the price of admission here. But we get a lot more than that as these superb actresses talk about their surprising self-doubts, anxieties before they perform, aging, marriages, reviewers, and swap inside stories of their interactions with fellow performers and directors.

I felt this documentary got off to a rather disjointed start but went more smoothly as it progressed. Some of the humor made me laugh out loud such as when Dench had to call the paramedics for a bee sting on her backside. Her description was hilarious of the very young EMT tech who asked her if she had a carer (in America would be a home aide) which made her furious and she told him to "f-off".

Overall, this film had its awkward moments and the technique of the talented director Roger Michell asking the four women from the wings to comment on a new topic didn't work very well, in my opinion. But just to sit in and eavesdrop on this get-together of four master artists was a real pleasure.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2088,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

I would say the wonderful archival film snippets of some of their performances on stage and screen would be enough for the price of admission here. But we get a lot more than that as these superb actresses talk about their surprising self-doubts, anxieties before they perform, aging, marriages, reviewers, and swap inside stories of their interactions with fellow performers and directors.

I felt this documentary got off to a rather disjointed start but went more smoothly as it progressed.
